title: Unable to create labeled videos on CoLab and Locally
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Google Colab wasn't generating any labeled videos (and still isn't), so I was suggested to make the labeled video locally after I trained a network on Colab. However, there were still no labeled videos being created. I found another post from early 2019 that had the same error output and they said something about changing "codec," but I don't know what that means.

Top log output is after I inputted the normal `create_labeled_video`() code
Bottom log output is adding `save_frames=True` as the last parameter of `create_labeled_video()`

### Operating System

Windows 10
Anaconda Prompt

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.1 for Colab

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

CPU

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Train network as you would on Colab
2. Download and extract the project folder
3. Change project path in config.yaml back from Google Drive to Windows
4. Open Anaconda and launch standard DLC
5. run `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path, [r'C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard
   ...: -2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi'])`

### Relevant log output

```shell
2021-09-06 16:54:36.644950: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:55] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_101.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_101.dll not found
2021-09-06 16:54:36.645244: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.
C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos  already exists!
Starting to process video: C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi
Loading C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi and data.
[mpeg4 @ 0000020dc9617080] timebase 500/124969 not supported by MPEG 4 standard, the maximum admitted value for the timebase denominator is 65535
Could not open codec 'mpeg4': Unspecified error
Duration of video [s]: 3.0, recorded with 249.94 fps!
Overall # of frames: 751 with cropped frame dimensions: 668 448
Generating frames and creating video.
100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 751/751 [00:01<00:00, 612.85it/s]

2021-09-06 16:56:17.244053: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:55] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_101.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_101.dll not found
2021-09-06 16:56:17.244315: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.
C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos  already exists!
Starting to process video: C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi
Loading C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard-2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi and data.
Duration of video [s]: 3.0, recorded with 249.94 fps!
Overall # of frames: 751 with cropped frame dimensions: 668 448
Generating frames and creating video.
[WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified
```


### Anything else?

I tried `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path, [r'C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\50cmTest-richard
   ...: -2021-09-06\videos\50cm-08262021.avi'], save_frames=True)` since that was a line of code I found in another post with the same error.
